* [`cobbler_system`](#cobbler_system): Puppet type for cobbler system object

## Classes

### <a name="cobbler"></a>`cobbler`

Class manages cobbler installation and configuraiton

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `cobbler` class:

* [`cobbler_config`](#-cobbler--cobbler_config)
* [`cobbler_modules_config`](#-cobbler--cobbler_modules_config)
* [`ensure`](#-cobbler--ensure)
* [`package`](#-cobbler--package)
* [`package_ensure`](#-cobbler--package_ensure)
* [`service`](#-cobbler--service)
* [`service_ensure`](#-cobbler--service_ensure)
* [`service_enable`](#-cobbler--service_enable)
* [`config_path`](#-cobbler--config_path)
* [`config_file`](#-cobbler--config_file)
* [`config_modules`](#-cobbler--config_modules)
* [`default_cobbler_config`](#-cobbler--default_cobbler_config)
* [`default_modules_config`](#-cobbler--default_modules_config)

##### <a name="-cobbler--cobbler_config"></a>`cobbler_config`

Data type: `Hash`

Hash of cobbler settings options. This hash is merged with the
default_cobbler_config hash from params class. All this options go to the
file defined with config_file parameter. There are no checks (yet?) done to
verify options passed with that hash

Default value: `{}`

##### <a name="-cobbler--cobbler_modules_config"></a>`cobbler_modules_config`

Data type: `Hash`

Hash of cobbler modules configuration. This hash is
merged with the default_modules_config hash from params class.
Example:
  cobbler_modules_config => {
    section1            => {
      option1 => value1,
      option2 => [ value1, value2],
    },
    section2.subsection => {
      option3 => value3,
    }
  }

Default value: `{}`

##### <a name="-cobbler--ensure"></a>`ensure`

Data type:

```puppet
Enum[
    'present',
    'absent'
  ]
```

The state of puppet resources within the module.

Default value: `$cobbler::params::ensure`

##### <a name="-cobbler--package"></a>`package`

Data type:

```puppet
Variant[
    Array[String],
    String
  ]
```

The package name or array of packages that provides cobbler.

Default value: `$cobbler::params::package`

##### <a name="-cobbler--package_ensure"></a>`package_ensure`

Data type:

```puppet
Enum[
    'present',
    'installed',
    'absent',
    'purged',
    'held',
    'latest'
  ]
```

The state of the package.

Default value: `$cobbler::params::package_ensure`

##### <a name="-cobbler--service"></a>`service`

Data type: `String`

Name of the service this modules is responsible to manage.

Default value: `$cobbler::params::service`

##### <a name="-cobbler--service_ensure"></a>`service_ensure`

Data type:

```puppet
Enum[
    'stopped',
    'running'
  ]
```

The state of the serivce in the system

Default value: `$cobbler::params::service_ensure`

##### <a name="-cobbler--service_enable"></a>`service_enable`

Data type:

```puppet
Variant[
    Boolean,
    Enum['manual','mask']
  ]
```

Whether a service should be enabled to start at boot

Default value: `$cobbler::params::service_enable`

##### <a name="-cobbler--config_path"></a>`config_path`

Data type: `Stdlib::Absolutepath`

The absolute path where cobbler configuration files reside. This to prepend
to config_file and config_modules options to build full paths to setttings
and modules.conf files.

Default value: `$cobbler::params::config_path`

##### <a name="-cobbler--config_file"></a>`config_file`

Data type: `String`

The title of main cobbler configuration file. The full path to that file is
build by prepending config_file with config_path parameters

Default value: `$cobbler::params::config_file`

##### <a name="-cobbler--config_modules"></a>`config_modules`

Data type: `String`

The title of cobbler modules configuration file. The full path to that file
is build by prepending config_modules with config_path parameters

Default value: `$cobbler::params::config_modules`

##### <a name="-cobbler--default_cobbler_config"></a>`default_cobbler_config`

Data type: `Hash`

Hash that contains default configuration options for cobbler. No checks are
performed to validate these configuration options. This is a left side hash
to be merged with cobbler_config hash to build config_file for cobbler

Default value: `$cobbler::params::default_cobbler_config`

##### <a name="-cobbler--default_modules_config"></a>`default_modules_config`

Data type: `Hash`

Hash that contains default configuration options for cobbler modules.
This is a left side hash  to be merged with cobbler_modules_config hash to
build config_modules file  for cobbler

Default value: `$cobbler::params::default_modules_config`

### <a name="cobbler--config"></a>`cobbler::config`

Manages configuration files for cobbler

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `cobbler::config` class:

* [`ensure`](#-cobbler--config--ensure)
* [`cobbler_config`](#-cobbler--config--cobbler_config)
* [`cobbler_modules_config`](#-cobbler--config--cobbler_modules_config)
* [`config_path`](#-cobbler--config--config_path)
* [`config_file`](#-cobbler--config--config_file)
* [`config_modules`](#-cobbler--config--config_modules)

##### <a name="-cobbler--config--ensure"></a>`ensure`

Data type:

```puppet
Enum[
    'present',
    'absent'
  ]
```

The state of puppet resources within the module.

##### <a name="-cobbler--config--cobbler_config"></a>`cobbler_config`

Data type: `Hash`

Hash of cobbler settings options. This hash is merged with the
default_cobbler_config hash from params class. All this options go to the
file defined with config_file parameter. There are no checks (yet?) done to
verify options passed with that hash

##### <a name="-cobbler--config--cobbler_modules_config"></a>`cobbler_modules_config`

Data type: `Hash`

Hash of cobbler modules configuration. This hash is
merged with the default_modules_config hash from params class.
Example:
  cobbler_modules_config => {
    section1            => {
      option1 => value1,
      option2 => [ value1, value2],
    },
    section2.subsection => {
      option3 => value3,
    }
  }

##### <a name="-cobbler--config--config_path"></a>`config_path`

Data type: `Stdlib::Absolutepath`

The absolute path where cobbler configuration files reside. This to prepend
to config_file and config_modules options to build full paths to setttings
and modules.conf files.

##### <a name="-cobbler--config--config_file"></a>`config_file`

Data type: `String`

The title of main cobbler configuration file. The full path to that file is
build by prepending config_file with config_path parameters

##### <a name="-cobbler--config--config_modules"></a>`config_modules`

Data type: `String`

The title of cobbler modules configuration file. The full path to that file
is build by prepending config_modules with config_path parameters

### <a name="cobbler--install"></a>`cobbler::install`

* [`package_ensure`](#-cobbler--install--package_ensure)

##### <a name="-cobbler--install--package"></a>`package`

Data type:

```puppet
Variant[
    Array[String],
    String
  ]
```

The package name or array of packages that provides cobbler.

##### <a name="-cobbler--install--package_ensure"></a>`package_ensure`

Data type:

```puppet
Enum[
    'present$',
    'installed',
    'absent',
    'purged',
    'held',
    'latest'
  ]
```

The state of the package.

## Defined types

### <a name="cobbler--config--ini"></a>`cobbler::config::ini`

Helps build ini configuration files for cobbler

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `cobbler::config::ini` defined type:

* [`ensure`](#-cobbler--config--ini--ensure)
* [`config_file`](#-cobbler--config--ini--config_file)
* [`options`](#-cobbler--config--ini--options)

##### <a name="-cobbler--config--ini--ensure"></a>`ensure`

Data type:

```puppet
Enum[
    'present',
    'absent'
  ]
```

The state of puppet resources within the module.

##### <a name="-cobbler--config--ini--config_file"></a>`config_file`

Data type: `Stdlib::Absolutepath`

Absolute path to configuration file

##### <a name="-cobbler--config--ini--options"></a>`options`

Data type: `Hash`

Hash of options to build config_file upon.

Example:
  cobbler_modules_config => {
    section1            => {
      option1 => value1,
      option2 => [ value1, value2],
    },
    section2.subsection => {
      option3 => value3,
    }
  }

## Resource types

### <a name="cobbler_distro"></a>`cobbler_distro`

Puppet type for cobbler distro object

#### Properties

The following properties are available in the `cobbler_distro` type.

##### `arch`

Valid values: `i386`, `x86_64`, `ia64`, `ppc`, `ppc64`, `s390`, `arm`

Sets the architecture for the PXE bootloader

Default value: `x86_64`

##### `comment`

An optional comment to associate with this distro

##### `ensure`

Valid values: `present`, `absent`

The basic property that the resource should be in.

Default value: `present`

##### `initrd`

An absolute filesystem path to a initrd image

##### `kernel`

An absolute filesystem path to a kernel image

##### `ksmeta`

Sets variables available for use in templates

Default value: `{}`

##### `owners`

List of users and groups as specified in /etc/cobbler/users.conf

Default value: `admin`

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `cobbler_distro` type.

* [`name`](#-cobbler_distro--name)
* [`path`](#-cobbler_distro--path)
* [`provider`](#-cobbler_distro--provider)

##### <a name="-cobbler_distro--name"></a>`name`

namevar

A string identifying the distribution

##### <a name="-cobbler_distro--path"></a>`path`

Local path or rsync location

##### <a name="-cobbler_distro--provider"></a>`provider`

The specific backend to use for this `cobbler_distro` resource. You will seldom need to specify this --- Puppet will
usually discover the appropriate provider for your platform.

### <a name="cobbler_profile"></a>`cobbler_profile`

Puppet type for cobbler profile object

#### Properties

The following properties are available in the `cobbler_profile` type.

##### `dhcp_tag`

DHCP tags for multiple networks usage

Default value: `default`

##### `distro`

Distribution (Parent distribution)

##### `ensure`

Valid values: `present`, `absent`

The basic property that the resource should be in.

Default value: `present`

##### `kickstart`

Path to kickstart template

##### `kopts`

Kernel Options

Default value: `{}`

##### `kopts_post`

Governs kernel options on the installed OS

Default value: `{}`

##### `ksmeta`

Sets variables available for use in templates

Default value: `{}`

##### `name_servers`

DNS search for name resolution

Default value: `[]`

##### `name_servers_search`

DNS search domains

Default value: `[]`

##### `repos`

Repos to auto-assign to this profile

Default value: `[]`

##### `virt_cpus`

How many virtual CPUs should koan give the virtual machine

##### `virt_ram`

How many megabytes of RAM to consume

##### `virt_type`

Valid values: `xenpv`, `xenfv`, `qemu`, `kvm`, `vmware`, `openvz`

Virtualization technology to use

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `cobbler_profile` type.

* [`name`](#-cobbler_profile--name)
* [`provider`](#-cobbler_profile--provider)

##### <a name="-cobbler_profile--name"></a>`name`

namevar

A string identifying the profile

##### <a name="-cobbler_profile--provider"></a>`provider`

The specific backend to use for this `cobbler_profile` resource. You will seldom need to specify this --- Puppet will
usually discover the appropriate provider for your platform.

### <a name="cobbler_repo"></a>`cobbler_repo`

Puppet type for cobbler repo object

#### Properties

The following properties are available in the `cobbler_repo` type.

##### `arch`

Valid values: `i386`, `x86_64`, `ia64`, `ppc`, `ppc64`, `s390`, `arm`, `src`

Specifies what architecture the repository should use

Default value: `x86_64`

##### `breed`

Valid values: `rsync`, `rhn`, `wget`, `yum`, `apt`, `wget`

The breed of repo distribution

Default value: `rsync`

##### `ensure`

Valid values: `present`, `absent`

The basic property that the resource should be in.

Default value: `present`

##### `mirror`

The addresss of the yum mirror

##### `mirror_locally`

Valid values: `true`, `false`

Specifies that this yum repo is to be referenced directly via kickstarts or mirrored locally on the cobbler server

Default value: `false`

##### `rpmlist`

List of package names part of a repo

Default value: `[]`

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `cobbler_repo` type.

* [`name`](#-cobbler_repo--name)
* [`provider`](#-cobbler_repo--provider)
* [`reposync`](#-cobbler_repo--reposync)

##### <a name="-cobbler_repo--name"></a>`name`

namevar

A string identifying the repo

##### <a name="-cobbler_repo--provider"></a>`provider`

The specific backend to use for this `cobbler_repo` resource. You will seldom need to specify this --- Puppet will
usually discover the appropriate provider for your platform.

##### <a name="-cobbler_repo--reposync"></a>`reposync`

Valid values: `true`, `false`

Run reposync upon repo creation

Default value: `false`

### <a name="cobbler_system"></a>`cobbler_system`

Puppet type for cobbler system object

#### Properties

The following properties are available in the `cobbler_system` type.

##### `ensure`

Valid values: `present`, `absent`

The basic property that the resource should be in.

Default value: `present`

##### `gateway`

Network gateway

Default value: `''`

##### `hostname`

System hostname

##### `interfaces`

Interfaces for the system

Default value: `{}`

##### `netboot_enabled`

Valid values: `true`, `false`

Netboot Enabled (PXE (re)install this machine at next boot?)

##### `profile`

Parent profile

##### `redhat_management_key`

Red Hat authorization key to use to register system

##### `redhat_management_server`

The RHN Satellite or Spacewalk server to use for registration

##### `server`

Server Override

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `cobbler_system` type.

* [`name`](#-cobbler_system--name)
* [`provider`](#-cobbler_system--provider)

##### <a name="-cobbler_system--name"></a>`name`

namevar

A string identifying the system

##### <a name="-cobbler_system--provider"></a>`provider`

The specific backend to use for this `cobbler_system` resource. You will seldom need to specify this --- Puppet will
usually discover the appropriate provider for your platform.
